The good woman named So-and-so says: The defiled and evil body that I have received is filled with the flow of filth
and is incapable of lower practices.
I vow to be a disciple and uphold the correct precepts for the rest of my life, and to practice them.
For what purpose do I become a novice nun?
It is for taking refuge in the Buddha, taking refuge in the Dharma, and taking refuge in the Sangha of monks.
It is for shaving the head and wearing the monastic robe.
How many precepts are there?
A novice nun has ten precepts.
First, for as long as one lives, one must not kill, and must not instruct others to kill.ğŸ”½Second, for as long as one lives, one must not steal, and must not instruct others to steal.
Third, for as long as one lives, one must not engage in sexual misconduct, and must not instruct others to do so.
Fourth, for as long as one lives, one must not marry, and must not instruct others to marry.
Fifth, for as long as one lives, one must not lie, and must not instruct others to lie.
Sixth, for the rest of one's life, one should not sing or dance, nor should one teach others to sing or dance, nor play the zither or flute.
Seventh, for the rest of one's life, one should not wear fragrant flowers, grease, or powder, nor should one teach others to wear grease or powder.
Eighth, for the rest of one's life, one should not lie on a high, beautiful, or carved bed, nor should one teach others to make a beautiful bed to lie on.
Ninth, for the rest of one's life, one should not drink alcohol, nor should one teach others to drink alcohol.
Tenth, for the rest of one's life, one should not eat again after noon, nor should one teach others to eat.
Seventy rules of deportment.
One should not wear silk and brocade clothes, nor make colorful clothes to give to others,
One should not speak harshly or tease each other, nor should one teach others to speak in an urgent manner.
One should not look at each other's bodies and laugh loudly with a laywoman.
One should not expose one's body and play with oneself in a secluded place.
One should not look in a mirror, smooth one's face, or paint one's eyebrows.
Do not be angry, resentful, ashamed, or speak with hatred.
Do not think about having sexual relations with a man and ask the upÄsikÄ what she is like.
Do not sit on wool.
Do not wear shoes or make shoes.
Do not covet the wealth of a household and forcefully demand things.
Do not sit on the bed of another's wife and open containers to inspect her clothes, saying this is good and that is ugly.
Those sixteen years and above should become novice nuns.
Those who are originally without flaws, chaste, complete, and not disgraced, and who are approved by their parents, may then enter the Way.
Those who are originally not chaste should not enter the Way.
Those who hide illnesses like stone people should not enter the Way.

Three people should go together;
Sit six feet away from the bed;
Kneel for a long time, ask about their well-being, and leave after speaking, do not discuss matters.

There are five things when the teacher speaks to you:
If you do not understand the meaning of the scriptures and precepts, you should ask;

Why is that?
The character li in this translation is the same as the character ni in other translations, but the Sanskrit pronunciation is different.
This is not the text of the precepts for novice nuns, nor is it the miscellaneous precepts for novice nuns.
They are all inconsistent with the original text, so it is correct to simply call it the Text of the Precepts for Novice Monks.
